officially exported to China for many years.
Vietnamese watermelons to
China are mostly through unofficial routes,
so they always encounter problems. Besides,
this cooperation will help Vietnamese agricultural products have a more
stable output,
whereby Vietnamese fresh watermelons must
not be contaminated with five types of watermelon.
Live plant quarantine subjects that China is concerned about:
All growing areas and packaging facilities for

Good karma must

A rare moon weighing 8 kg was

Ho Chi Minh City forestry department

Handed over Mr. Hac Nha Be, the person who

Ladies and gentlemen, in recent days, in
the fields around the buffer zone of the
Agarwood National Park in Tay Nong district,
Dong Thap province, there have been
interesting natural scenes appearing.  Many flocks of storks
fly here in search of food, sometimes lounging
in the fields, sometimes spreading their wings and flying across
the sky, creating a
peaceful and beautiful scene.
Storks include many types such as
white storks, ibises, snail storks, and storks.  Snails
listed in the Vietnam Red Book are
one of the species that are
seriously threatened in Southeast Asia and need to
be strictly protected because it is now a
time when farmers are cleaning their
fields and tilling the land.  and preparing to sow
rice in the winter-spring crop, so in the fields there are many
types of insects, fish, shrimp, crabs and snails. These are the
favorite foods of storks, so
they fly here from everywhere in search of
food. Thousands of them appear.  The stork
in the field in Tam Nong district is a
